gameFiles

Class MoveEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameFiles.MoveEngine

  • public class MoveEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the engine that calculates all collisions and movement in the game. It is closely tied with gameEngine where
    the two classes are dependant on each other. The collision methods and moveEnts ()were coded by Hock-Chuan Chua and modified to fit the program. The methods that apply forces to the ball were written by Mike, also modified.
    Version:
    v4.0 June 12th, 2014
    Author:
    Jason P'ng, Mike aka Wilkystyles, Hock-Chuan Chua

      • pointIntersectsLineVertical

        public static void pointIntersectsLineVertical(Ball s,
                                               float lineX,
                                               float timeLimit,
                                               CollisionResponse response)
        Detect collision for a moving point hitting a vertical line, within the given timeLimit. If collision is detected within the timeLimit, compute collision time and response in the given CollisionResponse object. Otherwise, set collision time to infinity. The result is passed back in the given CollisionResponse object.
        Written by Hock-Chuan Chau modified by Jason P'ng
        if (speedX == 0) - prevents arithmetic errors. Collision doesn't occur at a speed of 0.
        if (lineX > pointX) - determines which side of the line the ball is on.
        (t > 0 && t <= timeLimit) - Checks if a collision will occur withing the time limit.
        Parameters:
        Ball - s : The ball being checked for collision
        pointX - : x-position of the center of the point.
        pointY - : y-position of the center of the point.
        speedX - : speed in x-direction.
        speedY - : speed in y-direction.
        radius - : radius of the point. Zero for a true point.
        lineX - : x-value of the vertical line
        timeLimit - : max time to detect collision, in (0, 1] range.
        response - : If collision is detected, update the collision time and response. Otherwise, set collision time to infinity.
        distance - : the distance from the line to the ball.
        t - : the time it takes for the ball to collide with the line with the current velocity.

      • pointIntersectsLineHorizontal

        public static void pointIntersectsLineHorizontal(Ball s,
                                                 float lineY,
                                                 float timeLimit,
                                                 CollisionResponse response)
        See Also:
        movingPointIntersectsLineVertical().

      • pointIntersectsLineSegmentNoEndPoints

        public static void pointIntersectsLineSegmentNoEndPoints(Ball s,
                                                         float lineX1,
                                                         float lineY1,
                                                         float lineX2,
                                                         float lineY2,
                                                         float timeLimit,
                                                         CollisionResponse response)
        Detect collision for a moving point hitting hitting an arbitrary line segment, within the given timeLimit. No need to consider the two end points. If collision is detected within the timeLimit, compute collision time and response in the given CollisionResponse object. Otherwise, set collision time to infinity. The result is passed back in the given CollisionResponse object.
        Written by Hock-Chuan Chau modified by Jason P'ng
        Parameters:
        Ball - s : The ball being checked for collision
        pointX - : x-position of the center of the point.
        pointY - : y-position of the center of the point.
        speedX - : speed in x-direction.
        speedY - : speed in y-direction.
        radius - : radius of the point. Zero for a true point.
        lineX1 - : line's beginning point x value.
        lineY1 - : line's beginning point y value.
        lineX2 - : line's ending point x value.
        lineY2 - : line's ending point y value.
        timeLimit - : max time to detect collision, in (0, 1] range.
        response - : If collision is detected, update the collision time and response. Otherwise, set collision time to infinity.

      • pointIntersectsLineSegment

        public static void pointIntersectsLineSegment(Ball s,
                                              float lineX1,
                                              float lineY1,
                                              float lineX2,
                                              float lineY2,
                                              float timeLimit,
                                              CollisionResponse response)
        Detect collision for a moving point hitting hitting an arbitrary line segment, within the given timeLimit. Consider both the end points. If collision is detected within the timeLimit, compute collision time and response in the given CollisionResponse object. Otherwise, set collision time to infinity. The result is passed back in the given CollisionResponse object. Written by Hock-Chuan Chau modified by Jason P'ng
        Parameters:
        Ball - s : The ball being checked for collision
        pointX - : x-position of the center of the point.
        pointY - : y-position of the center of the point.
        speedX - : speed in x-direction.
        speedY - : speed in y-direction.
        radius - : radius of the point. Zero for a true point.
        lineX1 - : line's beginning point x value.
        lineY1 - : line's beginning point y value.
        lineX2 - : line's ending point x value.
        lineY2 - : line's ending point y value.
        timeLimit - : max time to detect collision, in (0, 1] range.
        response - : If collision is detected, update the collision time and response. Otherwise, set collision time to infinity.

      • pointIntersectsPoint

        public static void pointIntersectsPoint(Ball s,
                                        float p2X,
                                        float p2Y,
                                        float p2Radius,
                                        float timeLimit,
                                        CollisionResponse response)
        Detect collision for a moving point hitting a stationary point, within the given timeLimit. If collision is detected within the timeLimit, compute collision time and response in the given CollisionResponse object. Otherwise, set collision time to infinity. The result is passed back in the given CollisionResponse object. Written by Hock-Chuan Chau modified by Jason P'ng
        Parameters:
        Ball - s : The ball being checked for collision
        p1X - : x-position of the center of point p1.
        p1Y - : y-position of the center of point p1.
        p1SpeedX - : p1's speed in x-direction.
        p1SpeedY - : p1's speed in y-direction.
        p1Radius - : p1's radius. Zero for a true point.
        p2X - : x-position of the center of point p2.
        p2Y - : y-position of the center of point p2.
        p2Radius - : p2's radius. Zero for a true point.
        timeLimit - : max time to detect collision, in (0, 1] range.
        p1Response - : If collision is detected, update the collision time and response for p1. Otherwise, set collision time to infinity.
